intro: Marrubium cinereum, commonly known as grey horehound, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has a taproot system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Marrubium cinereum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
